title: Chocolate chip cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180C/160C. Line a baking tray with a piece of baking paper.
Put the dry ingredients into a bowl.
Melt the butter in a pan or in the microwave, once melted let it cool a little.
Mix the wet ingredients together.
Slowly while mixing add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients.
Drop heaped teaspoons of mixture onto the baking tray, allowing 5cm/2in of space between each cookie.
Bake for 10 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the cookies are just set.

title: Homemade Granola
instructions: Preheat the oven to 150C/160C. Line a baking tray with a piece of baking paper.
Add all the ingredients except the cranberries into a mixing bowl and mix them well.
Spread the mixture onto the baking tray and spread it evenly.
Bake for 10 minutes then stir the mixture and bake for another 10 minutes.
Let it cool of and add in the raisins.

title: Veggie noodle stir-fry
instructions: Bring a pot of water to boil and cook the noodles until al dente, according to package directions. Drain and rinse well to remove any excess starch. Set aside.
Meanwhile, warm a large skillet over medium heat. Add the oil, onion and salt. Cooking, stirring occasionally, until the onion is tender, about 4 to 6 minutes.
Add the remaining vegetables and cook until they are tender and caramelizing on the edges, stirring every minute or two.
Once the vegetables are done, add the noodles and ½ cup teriyaki sauce to the pan. Stir to combine, and cook just until the ingredients are all warmed through.
Remove the skillet from the heat. Add toasted sesame oil, to taste.
Serve the noodles in bowls with sliced green onion and a little sprinkle of sesame seeds on top.

title: Strawberry Salad
instructions: To make the dressing: In a small bowl whisk oil, vinegar, mustard, maple syrup, salt, and pepper until well combined.
In a large bowl place greens, strawberries, cheese, and nuts. Pour the dressing over the salad mixture and toss to combine. Serve immediately.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

title: American Pancakes
instructions: Mix the flour, baking powder and a pinch of salt together in a large bowl.
Add the eggs and milk and whisk them together either with a balloon whisk or electric hand beaters until smooth.
Heat 1 tsp of oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. When the oil looks frothy pour in rounds of the batter.
Cook the pancakes on their first side for about 1-2 mins or until lots of tiny bubbles start to appear and pop on the surface. Flip the pancakes over and cook for a further minute on the other side.
Serve your pancakes stacked up on a plate with a drizzle of maple syrup and any of your favourite toppings.

title: Pizza Siciliana
instructions: Combine yeast, sugar, salt, olive oil and water to a large bowl; stir until combined.
Fold through flour until just combined, turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5-10 minutes or until a smooth ball forms.

Place dough ball into a lightly oiled bowl, cover with a kitchen towel. Set aside in a warm drought free place for 30 minutes or until dough has doubled in size. Turn dough out on a floured surface and knock back (punch) the dough to remove excess air, lightly knead
Preheat Pizza oven to 200C.
Divide dough into three 220g balls. Roll out one piece of pizza dough to form a 24-26cm disc and place onto a large square of baking paper.
Prick base with a fork or pizza docker and spread base with 2 tablespoons tomato sauce.
Top base with mozzarella.
Place back in the oven for 15 minutes.
Top with basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil.

title: Prawn spaghetti
instructions: Cook your spaghetti in a large pan of salted boiling water according to the packet instructions.

Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the garlic. Heat some virgin olive oil in a large frying pan, then toss in the garlic and crumble in the chilli. As the garlic begins to colour, add the prawns and sauté them for a minute. Add the white wine and tomato purée, and simmer for a couple of minutes.
When the pasta is ready, drain it, reserving a little of the cooking water.
Toss the spaghetti with the sauce, squeeze in the lemon juice and add a little of the reserved cooking water if you want to loosen the sauce a bit.
Serve with sea salt and black pepper

title: Apple pie
instructions: In a medium-sized bowl, add the flour and a pinch of salt. Mix with fork until combined.
Add in cubed butter and break up into flour with a fork. Mixture will still have lumps about the size of small peas.

Gradually add the ice water and continue to mix until the dough starts to come together. You may not need all of the water, but if the dough is too dry then add more. The dough should not be very tacky or sticky.
Work the dough together with your hands and turn out onto a surface. Work into a ball and cover with cling wrap. Refrigerate.
Peel the apples, then core and slice.
In a bowl, add the sliced apples, sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and juice from the lemon. Mix until combined and all apples are coated. Refrigerate.
Preheat the oven to 200°C.
On a floured surface roll out the dough until round and about 3 mm thick.
Roll the dough around the rolling pin and unroll onto a pie dish making sure the dough reaches all edges. Trim extra if necessary.
Pour in apple filling mixture and pat down.
Bake pie for 50-60 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and no greyish or undercooked pastry remains.

title: Beef Tacos
instructions: Place the flank steak in a 9x13 pan. Pour lime juice over the steak and let marinate for 30 minutes, at room temperature.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine zest of 2 limes, salt, sugar, pepper, chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder and oregano.
Rub both sides of the steak with the spice mixture.
Preheat grill to high heat. Place steak directly on the grill and cook for 5 minutes on each side. Remove from grill and let the steak rest on a cutting board, covered with foil, for 10 minutes.
While the steak is resting, warm the corn tortillas on the grill or use a gas flame to char them slightly.
Cut the steak into strips, against the grain. Place steak strips in the corn tortillas and top with red onion, chopped cucumber and cilantro. Squeeze with lime juice, if desired. Serve warm.

title: Tomato soup
instructions: Melt butter over medium heat in a large saucepan.
Chop up the oniones.
Add onion wedges, water, can of tomatoes with their juices, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a simmer. Cook, uncovered, for about 40 minutes. Stir occasionally and add additional salt as needed.
Blend the soup until smooth, and then season to taste.

title: Banana bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 16x10 inch loaf pans.

Sift the flour, salt and baking soda into a large bowl. In a separate bowl, mix together the margarine and sugar until smooth. Stir in the mashed up bananas, eggs, and walnuts until well blended. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mixture, and stir just until blended.
Slice the figs in half and put them on top of the batter

Bake for 60 to 70 minutes in the preheated oven, until a knife inserted into the crown of the loaf comes out clean. Let the loaves cool in the pans for at least 5 minutes, then turn out onto a cooling rack, and cool completely.

title: Sourdough Bread
instructions: Whisk the starter and water together in a large bowl with a fork. Add the flour and salt. Mix to combine, then finish by hand to form a rough dough. Cover with a damp towel and let rest for 1 hour. Replenish your starter with fresh flour and water, and store according to preference. After the dough has rested, work it into a ball, about 15 to 20 seconds.

Cover the bowl with a damp towel and let rise at room temperature, about 8 to 10 hours at 21°C. The dough is ready when it has doubled in size, has a few bubbles on the surface, and jiggles when you move the bowl from side to side.

Coax the dough onto a floured surface. Dimple the dough all over with floured fingertips. Gently shape it into a round and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, line an 20-cm bowl or proofing basket with a towel and dust with flour. Using a bench scraper, scoop up the dough and flip it over so that the smooth side is facing down. Shape it again and then flip it back over. Cup the dough and gently pull it toward you in a circular motion to tighten its shape. Place into your lined bowl, seam side up.
Cover the dough and refrigerate for 1 hour to set its structure. When ready to bake, let sit at room temperature while the oven heats up.
Preheat your oven to (260°C). Cut a piece of parchment to fit the size of your baking pot.

Place the parchment over the dough and invert the bowl to release. Dust the surface with flour and rub with your hands to coat. Using the tip of a small knife, score the dough however you wish. Use the parchment to transfer the dough into the baking pot.

Place the pot on the center rack, and reduce the heat to 450°F (230°C). Bake the dough for 20 minutes, covered. Remove the lid, and continue to bake for 30 minutes, checking after 20. Lift the loaf out of the pot, and bake directly on the oven rack for the last 5 to 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 1 hour before slicing.

title: Seafood Paella
instructions: Heat the oil in a paella pan or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until onion is soft. Add the paprika and turmeric. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute or until aromatic.
Add the rice. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Combine the stock cubes and water and add to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.
Arrange the prawns on top of the rice. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the rice is tender and the prawns curl and change colour. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve with lemon wedges.

title: Vegtable Dumplings
instructions: Place a large skillet or wok on the stove over medium-high heat.
Add oil, ginger, garlic, and cabbage. Cook until cabbage begins to wilt and shrink down.
Add mushrooms, green onion, and carrots, along with the soy sauce and sesame oil. Continue to cook until liquid begins to evaporate.
Season with pepper, to taste, and salt only if needed.

To form the dumplings, remove 1 wonton wrapper from the package, covering the others with a damp cloth. Brush the edges of the wrapper lightly with water. Place 1/2 rounded teaspoon of the mixture in the center of the wrapper. Shape as desired. Set on a sheet pan and cover with a damp cloth. Repeat procedure until all of the filling is gone.
Using a steaming apparatus of your choice, bring 1/4 to 1/2-inch of water to a simmer over medium heat.

Spray the steamer's surface lightly with the non-stick vegetable spray to prevent sticking. Place as many dumplings as will fit into a steamer, without touching each other. Cover and steam for 10 to 12 minutes over medium heat.
Remove the dumplings from the steamer to a heatproof platter and place in oven to keep warm. Repeat until all dumplings are cooked.

title: French Toast
instructions: Beat together egg, milk, salt, desired spices and vanilla.
Heat a lightly oiled skillet over medium-high heat.
Dunk each slice of bread in egg mixture, soaking both sides. Place in pan, and cook on both sides until golden. Serve hot.

title: Mushroom tagliatelle
instructions: Chop the garlic, spring onions and mushrooms.

Heat the oil in a pan and gently fry the spring onions and garlic for a few minutes, or until pale golden-brown. Add the mushrooms and fry over a high heat for 8-10 minutes. Tip the spinach into the pan, and stir regularly as it wilts. Continue cooking over a medium heat until most of the water has evaporated.

Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the crème fraîche. Return the pan to the heat, bring to the boil, and simmer until the sauce has thickened. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground pepper.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large pan of salted boiling water, according to packet instructions. Once cooked, drain the pasta, and toss with the mushroom and spinach sauce. Serve immediately.

title: French croissants
instructions: Place the flour, sugar, yeast, and salt in a large bowl and whisk together until combined.
Slice the butter into 1/8-inch thick slices and toss in the flour mixture to coat.
Add the milk and stir together until a stiff dough forms.
Wrap the dough tightly in plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour.
On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into a long rectangle shape.
Fold it into thirds (like a letter), turn 90 degrees, and repeat 4 to 6 more times, or until the dough has large streaks of butter in it but it is smooth and flat.
Wrap tightly and chill for 1 more hour, then divide the dough in half and roll each portion out to a thickness of about 1/8-inch, in a long rectangle shape (approx. 10-inches wide by 22-inches long).
Cut the dough into long, skinny triangles (about 5-inches at the wide end).
Notch the wide end of each triangle with about a 1/2-inch cut, then roll from the wide end to the pointed end, tucking the point under the croissant.
Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet, cover loosely with plastic wrap, and allow to proof until doubled in size (1 to 2 hours).
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Combine 1 large beaten egg with a teaspoon or two of water and gently brush the croissants with it
Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until puffed, golden brown, and flaky.

title: Pumpkin Soup
instructions: Finely chop the onions. Peel and deseed the pumpkin and chop it into chunks
Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large saucepan, then gently cook the chopped onions for 5 mins, until soft but not coloured.
Add the pumpkin to the pan, then carry on cooking for 8-10 mins, stirring occasionally until it starts to soften and turn golden.
Pour 700ml vegetable or chicken stock into the pan and season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil, then simmer for 10 mins until the squash is very soft.
Pour 150ml double cream into the pan, bring back to the boil, then purée with a hand blender. For an extra-velvety consistency you can pour the soup through a fine sieve.

title: Smoothie Bowl
instructions: Add banana, protein powder, berries, spirulina, spinach and coconut water to a blender and blend until smooth.
Add the smoothie to a bowl and top with the remaining ingredients.

title: Porridge
instructions: Place the oats, milk, 300ml water and salt into a pan. Bring slowly to the boil, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon. Cook the porridge slowly for a couple of minutes, then pour into a bowl.
Add the topping of your choice and serve immediately.

title: Salmon on a vegetable bed
instructions: Top and tail the courgette and carrots and slice into long strips using a vegetable peeler.
Cut each strip into long, thin strands — or use a spiraliser, if you have one.
Season each salmon fillet with freshly ground black pepper.
Heat 1 tbsp of the live oil in a nonstick frying pan and cook the salmon for 3 mins on each side.
Add the courgetti, carrots and spinach to a saucepan, along with the remaining olive oil, 2 tbsp water and salt and pepper.
Cook for 3-4 mins, or until the vegetable begins to soften.
When cooked, divide the the vegetables between 2 bowls and top each with a salmon fillet and a sprinkling of freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately

title: Indian Curry
instructions: Heat the oil in a deep saucepan or a medium-sized wok. Fry the onions and garlic until the onions are caramelised.
Add the salt, cumin, coriander, turmeric and red chilli powder. Cook for a minute and then add the tomato. Cook the sauce until it begins to thicken.
Add 4 tablespoons of water and stir. Stir in the chickpeas. Mash in a few of the chickpeas, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the ginger and garam masala. Cook for another minute.
Serve with basmati rice.
